text: A woman has been dating guy after guy, but it never seems to work out. She's unaware that she's actually been dating the same guy over and over; a shapeshifter who's fallen for her, and is certain he's going to get it right this time.

A woman has been dating guy after guy, but it never seems to work out. She's unaware that she's actually been dating the same guy over and over; a shapeshifter who's fallen for her, and is certain he's going to get it right this time.

Today was the day. He and Valarie had been dating for almost a year. Well, this time around. This was the 4th time they dated, but all of the other times they had crashed and burned after less than 8 months. So he was certain that this was the right face.

Not that his current one was technically "legal".

One day a woman he was interested in told him she preferred brunettes. When he woke up the next morning his hair color was different, and there were changes to his face. And that's when he knew. He could control this.

Which came in handy when he met Valarie. They dated for about 3 months the first time, then she broke up with him when he flirted with another woman. He realized his mistake, but she just wouldn't take him back. So he changed. He wasn't really certain why the other times he dated her didn't work out.

He was about to tell her she was ruining the moment, when she turned to him. "I've been talking to my therapist for months now about my past relationships. She's helped me see that I keep dating the same kind of man. She's been helping me see that I keep dating you."

A woman has been dating guy after guy, but it never seems to work out. She's unaware that she's actually been dating the same guy over and over; a shapeshifter who's fallen for her, and is certain he's going to get it right this time.

Today was the day. He and Valarie had been dating for almost a year. Well, this time around. This was the 4th time they dated, but all of the other times they had crashed and burned after less than 8 months. So he was certain that this was the right face.   He had it all planned out. He bought a ring, made the dinner reservations, and rented out the observation deck of her favorite city viewing spot. 

It was hard being a shapeshifter. Once you started changing, even just once, there was so much to keep track of, and so much work to do to create a new "you". It was a lot of work to keep track of all the details of your life, and to make sure that you didn't leave any evidence of your past, while still maintaining a legal identity. Not that his current one was technically "legal". He had been born in a small town in the Midwest, and had been a "normal" guy until he had been in a car accident. They had expected horrible scarring, and were surprised there was none. But he didn't look like he had either. In fact, he suddenly grew 3 inches, and looked and awful like the popular actor of the time, the one all the girls in his class had been gushing over. At first he thought he had the best luck, but then he realized the changes just freaked every one out. He was a freak, and he had to leave town. One day a woman he was interested in told him she preferred brunettes. When he woke up the next morning his hair color was different, and there were changes to his face. And that's when he knew. He could control this.

Which came in handy when he met Valarie. They dated for about 3 months the first time, then she broke up with him when he flirted with another woman. He realized his mistake, but she just wouldn't take him back. So he changed. He wasn't really certain why the other times he dated her didn't work out. Maybe it was the fact that he was a bit of a playboy, and she wasn't. He didn't cheat, but who doesn't like attention? But this time, it seemed like she accepted him for what he was, and this time he was going to get to marry her.

Dinner was strangely tense, which he had not been expected. He asked about her day, but all she would say was that she had an extra long session with her therapist, and they could talk about it later. He thought that was weird, but they were in a restaurant; maybe she didn't want to get emotional there? He had been looking forward to this night for a long time, and he was determined to make it special.

They went to the observation deck, and if anything the atmosphere got even more intense. She was acting like she was mad at him, and he was starting to get frustrated. He was about to tell her she was ruining the moment, when she turned to him. "I've been talking to my therapist for months now about my past relationships. She's helped me see that I keep dating the same kind of man. She's been helping me see that I keep dating you."

He recoiled in shock, suddenly fearful. No one could know his secret, not even her, it was too dangerous. SHe looked away from him, holding the railing as she looked out over the city. He didn't want to do it, but he had to. He got ready to push her.

"Well, not literally you, but your type. And it just isn't good for me. So, I'm sorry, but this is goodbye."

He stopped just before pushing her, relieved for a moment. Then angry again, fists clenched, just what did he have to be to keep her?

He recoiled in shock, suddenly fearful. No one could know his secret, not even her, it was too dangerous. SHe looked away from him, holding the railing as she looked out over the city. He didn't want to do it, but he had to. He got ready to push her.

"Well, not literally you, but your type. And it just isn't good for me. So, I'm sorry, but this is goodbye."

He stopped just before pushing her, relieved for a moment. Then angry again, fists clenched, just what did he have to be to keep her? He was about to push her, when he felt a hand on his shoulder. 

"You're a good man and you deserve better. I'm going to leave and start a new life somewhere else, a whole new me. I wish the best for you."

And with that he finally felt shame. He was the one who had been deceiving her, and she called him a good man. He let her go, and decided that this was it. He would keep this face and identity, but make a new life for himself, without her. He took the ring box out of his pocket, left it on a table, and walked away.
